intro: Saurauia othmanii, commonly known as the Othman's saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of North Africa, particularly Morocco and Algeria. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with dense, evergreen foliage. Its flowers are small, white or pale pink, and are clustered in inflorescences, often blooming in spring. Saurauia othmanii is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, and it thrives in cool, moist environments.
